EN

The article focuses on President Trump's crypto entanglements threatening the CLARITY Act timeline, with Senator Chris Murphy accusing him of 'criminal conduct' regarding a UAE crypto deal involving World Liberty Financial. This controversy is creating partisan challenges for the crypto market structure bill aimed at providing regulatory clarity. Meanwhile, the crypto market saw a selloff with BTC down 3% at $76k before rebounding, while Vitalik Buterin criticized Ethereum's L2-focused roadmap in a lengthy post. Other notable developments include Y Combinator's $500k USDC funding announcement and Circle's $30,000 hackathon for AI agents.

Key Points

  • Senator Murphy accuses Trump of criminal conduct in UAE crypto deal
  • Trump's crypto connections threaten CLARITY Act timeline for regulatory clarity
  • Crypto market fell with BTC -3% at $76k before rebounding
  • Vitalik Buterin criticized Ethereum's L2-focused roadmap
  • Y Combinator announced $500k funding in USDC

Senator Murphy alleged ‚Äúpotentially criminal conduct‚Äù tied to a $500M deal where UAE-backed Aryam Investment purchased 49% of World Liberty Financial four days before Trump took office. Per WSJ reporting, roughly $187M flowed to Trump family entities and $31M to special envoy Steve Witkoff‚Äôs family, shortly before the administration greenlit expanded UAE access to advanced AI chips that Biden had restricted. This all happened while the White House hosted a two-hour crypto summit Monday with Ripple, Coinbase, Kraken, Tether, Circle, and major banks to negotiate stablecoin yield provisions in the CLARITY Act. No deal was reached, but the administration set a February deadline for compromise. üó£Ô∏è What They‚Äôre Saying ‚ÄúThat is corruption. Those are the elements of a bribe. This is potentially criminal conduct,‚Äù Murphy said on the Senate floor. He warned that ‚Äúthe rule of law is coming back ‚Äù and that those involved ‚Äúare going to jail.‚Äù Trump told reporters Monday he was unaware of the investment: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know about it. My sons are handling that. My family is handling it, and I guess they get investments from different people.‚Äù A World Liberty Financial spokesperson flatly denied any connection: ‚ÄúAny claim that this deal had anything to do with the Administration‚Äôs actions on chips is 100% false. The leftwing media is dishonestly pushing baseless innuendo.‚Äù üß† Why It Matters So where does this leave us? The crypto market structure bill that‚Äôs supposed to bring regulatory clarity is now caught in the middle of a new partisan battle. Democrats are tying passage to anti-corruption provisions targeting Trump‚Äôs crypto businesses. Banks are still clinging to the stablecoin provisions as a deal breaker. And the UAE scandal is providing ammunition to anyone who wants to slow things down. For markets: Regulatory uncertainty isn‚Äôt going away. The bill that was supposed to provide a ‚Äúfoundational framework‚Äù by Q1 is now hostage to partisan warfare. Now we wait to see if the administration can separate Trump‚Äôs personal crypto ventures from the industry‚Äôs legislative priorities‚Ä¶ üåé Macro Crypto and Markets Crypto majors are red but rebounding after a major selloff;
